p: This plant has been cultivated in many countries including Iran, the United States, the United Kingdom, Bulgaria, Turkey, Japan, and India. It grows wild in many parts of the world and is widely distributed in North America, Europe, Asia and the Middle East [ 7, 32]. R. damascena has been cultivated for various purposes in Iran from ancient times, and this country has a long history of producing and exporting its EO around the world [ 33, 34].
